New Records: The White Sox set a franchise record for losses in a single season with 107 losses, beating the previous mark set by the 1970 team with 56-106 record
Key Match Events: Garrett Crochet struck out eight batters, including an AL record-tying seven straight to start the game
Pre-Game Insights: The manager emphasized the importance of managing the pitcher's inning count, as seen with Garrett Crochet being pulled early
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore expressed that the team will have major decisions to make following the season, and that the worst record of the modern era is still in play
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox will be back in action on Monday against the Baltimore Orioles with a 3:05 p.m. ET start
Others: The worst record of all-time is unattainable, as the 1899 Cleveland Spiders went a dismal 20-134
